title: Kroger interim CEO Ron Sargent buys former Celtics co-owner Steve Pagliuca’s Back Bay mansion
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Luxury Homes Sargent, who previously served as the CEO of Staples, purchased the pricey pad in Boston's Back Bay neighborhood for $11.
5 million.
362 Marlborough Street.

title: Artist’s colorful Rhode Island home hits the market for $1.9M
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Real Estate News The Tiverton home includes six bedrooms, two kitchens, a pool, and a cottage that doubles as an art studio.
Lauren Hollingshead ShareSend this article to your social connections.
An artist’s home in Tiverton, Rhode Island — where the interior walls are practically a gallery — has hit the market.

title: Report: Red Sox’ offer to Pete Alonso was for ‘significantly less money’ than Orioles
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "They were in on Pete.
And I thought it was gonna happen, to be honest.
" Pete Alonso is leaving the Mets to join the AL East — but not with Boston.

title: Suffolk poll: 1 in 3 have considered leaving Mass. over costs
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Almost one-quarter of voters said their greatest concern was healthcare costs, trailed by worries over housing affordability and taxes.
Ben Pennington for The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin December 10, 2025 | 4:34 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
One in three Massachusetts voters have toyed with the idea of leaving the state over concerns about the cost of living, according to a recent poll from Suffolk University and The Boston Globe.

title: City Council calls for more transparency from Wu administration on school closures
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Frustrated families are being left in the dark about how Boston's leaders are deciding which schools need to close, councilors said.
Boston City Hall.
Pat Greenhouse/Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Are you leaving Mass. in 2026 because it’s too expensive?

bullets: Tell Us One-third of the voters in a Globe/Suffolk University poll say they’ve considered leaving in the past year.

title: Stylist to Boston’s ‘most fabulous socialites’ accused of stealing more than $400,000 in Saks refund scheme
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Authorities allege Suhail Kwatra refunded items his clients purchased but never picked up, converting the funds into gift cards he purportedly spent on himself.
Suhail Kwatra at Saks in 2014.
